3fac80207d6e15effe0395c93f3ad5fb.text: Excellent, both prototypes survived intact. I can order Renfield and his team to move on to stage two.

82055e7bfbace29f54c8d6a49e1fdb33.text: While you lost one of Renfield's prototypes, at least the other is intact. But your carelessness could cost us the war.

94872bc7d971f79c3e208d7474968e25.text: Your incompetence knows no bounds. Not one, but both of Renfield's prototypes destroyed... you may have cost us the war!

561bbfc8f2624edf989e488a25d940d2.text: Player is given a tank capable of freezing units in ice for this mission. They are tasked to Freeze 2 Hostile Robots that are present, and make sure they survive (frozen) till the end.

f3e1b9ed02476ca31865176a2191eeca.text: These machines are not currently themselves. Look past their malfunctioning aggression, and see them as living beings.

8a6eec61361f06997cdc5bbdc4aa01a4.text: Thank you for protecting the sentient life. I am sure I will be able to restore their programming.

7a564e0b851b8dbf8958b421d445ab86.text: It is unfortunate you were unable to safely secure both machines, but I am grateful you showed restraint and kept them alive.

cbf69b2b5b781407e3b15508d0eb86ae.text: I understand your hand was forced. But at least one of the machines survived, and his Server Sisters will be thankful.

f0422822446e227bf46575d8b432324f.text: I understand your hand was forced. But I must mourn the loss of life... <connection lost>

13a512424625976fb4b28cbdb89f676e.text: There are two neutral robots laying mines on the map, ignoring both players and enemies. The Player needs to defend them both to the end.

3749b6486c9aed92937d951393253aef.text: Our sentient mine layers have lost I/O and are attempting to run old routines. Protect these blind helpless creatures.

481cd62aaa680829174eaf325a7ceee7.text: With the Vek destroyed, we can safely attempt repairs on the machines. Thank you.

7bcfa28c6eb1361cffe404a6cf0982da.text: These factories are manufacturing hostile machines, but there are hundreds of innocent lives within. Please defend them while we try to shut them down safely.

5026e091806cdf70ac36b41ac8b386c3.text: I've broken through their firewall and safely disengaged the factories from the Power Grid. They will no longer pose a threat.

d3c01e806f5775787c8d9e3b5ed4a633.text: That factory not only contained life, but could create it. Few such facilities remain on our island. Now there is one less than before.

1398e7a562a64472d42e6604882ca469.text: Those factories not only contained life, but could create it. Few such facilities remain on our island. Now there are two less than before.

95fb34bc5505e3ed8f87d61d5516722f.text: is a misnomer at this point. Field of battle is full of enemy units incased in ice, every turn more units come out of the ice. No special objective, just a straight battle.

d1b0ddcc6d25e745d322a9e204c87137.text: When I lost control of my environmental processes, hundreds of Vek and machines alike were frozen solid. As the island comes back online, these fresh dangers are being freed.

988cc65e20d12919c0bc2b022f7313c4.text: Those machines were beyond repair after suffering such extreme temperatures; killing them was a necessity to save more life. I hope.

d679ef50d356e5c454169e2554259117.text: it's too bad you'll have to kill these bots

f7a4a1b9f6cc9e740f5130b238c47869.text: I cannot advocate killing the hostile machines in this region, but I acknowledge their threat is too great to ignore.

290ed4d8bc178b07ba6c68d488c52da0.text: It does not feel like a victory when the battle is fought against the sick within your own population.

f239282ba82f9cf88307e41692779e1a.text: Generic battle, but the map has 2 FROZEN abnormally dangerous robots on it. Player should be encouraged to avoid freeing the robots, though they are not penalized so it shouldn't sound like an objective.

b3e2e73483747b8a4a2514fb91e84a3f.text: Threat Diagnostic: <Machines: Frozen. Threat: Very high.> I recommend you avoid them.

b53331c2fe1d8805d648e4dbc06ded6a.text: The Vek are enough of a threat to your survival, I am sorry that my kind is unwell and providing additional complications.

351413d5f9b14b5fcd96851ba763d68a.text: Generic battle, but the map is full of mines that freeze the enemy.

20f4820f3cf67e196d514fe70ea418c7.text: I calculate there are still three hundred and seventy-three cryo-mines in this area intended for pacification of hostile machines. Keep your sensors on high.

4fcaa83c63eb99c0bf068f3042079524.text: Leave everything the cryo-mines froze to my cleanup droids. I will devote the processing time to ensure they are safely disposed of.

f57f2b501f389f3f7cc6eb8b6d098046.text: One of my environmental processes crashed, and the result was an entire city encased in ice. The lives within are still functioning - but they will die if not freed in time.

bacc9b9b87f55061797e1aec609a386a.text: There should be no lasting damage to the occupants. And my environmental monitor is functioning normally again.

9425d9092b36ff879057c025311a9a4a.text: Those buildings are now icy tombs for both machine and organic life. We will free them after the war and dispose of them respectfully.

2b78b71d000fa54eea25669e08cfcb47.text: The local coolant station detonated, releasing storms of cryo-nanites into the atmosphere. Avoid them or your Mechs may be flash-frozen.

6760f4cd2a3bf2d33b354c84a33e9b6a.text: Good to see you thawed out. I am working to contain the rogue cryo-nanites, and the storms in the region have already ceased.

21f837884f150a855449ca6d0cf1038a.text: A Vek hive lies directly beneath the waste disposal tanks in this region. Detonate the vats, and the chemical runoff will destroy the hive.

fa83ced380418ee02369ded08be90aa6.text: The vats in this region contain chemicals poisonous to the Vek - breach the containment vats, and the Vek will vacate the sector.

a92140c6f95c417fdf3cd0e956328a67.text: Unfortunately, not enough chemicals were seeded into the ground - the Vek still remain in the sector.

67bce3b49c78ba681559cf2e10d712e9.text: While the Vek advance was slowed, not enough vats were destroyed to halt them. Unfortunate, but there is nothing more to be done.

d84795f8f8fa671ca9301f4d73bca3ad.text: 100% of the vats were destroyed and the chemicals released. Our sensors are already picking up diminished Vek activity in the region.

0d65ae02ff8d2aa7a0a02411c8174749.text: Vek hives infest the mountains in this sector. An A.C.I.D. Launcher is stationed in the region - defend it while it disassembles the mountain range.

c8ff00593cf31535f31172898b8292e7.text: We need the #squad to defend this A.C.I.D. Launcher while it dissolves the Vek hives infesting the mountains.

88bee54b76411e6439f9c98b43f07e37.text: Disappointing - the Launcher and its crew are lost, and the mountains and the Vek hives remain. We'll need to abandon the sector.

940a24846509d6fc704f46c64db77ec9.text: The A.C.I.D. Launcher was destroyed, along with its crew. I will inform the families personally, and order the sector quarantined at once.

e931552336c876e9f18c07792e891f6e.text: The Vek hives remain. Sensors report they are spawning new Vek. We'll have to abandon the sector before they overrun us.

1538f185cb1a18f42a82cbbf82447e76.text: The Launcher is still active, but the hives in the mountains remain. Sensors report the Vek swarming the area - we have to pull back.

e06306dd374a62249e22d88b178e5586.text: The A.C.I.D. Launcher was destroyed along with its crew - yet their sacrifice was not in vain. The Vek hives have been eradicated.

9213cd75a2b61a197162aaab39f69e26.text: Your mission was a success, commander - the A.C.I.D. Launcher is intact and the Vek disintegrated.

c83ed3c3536a8bbb7fb538a863da65f4.text: Detritus has assigned an A.C.I.D. tank in this sector to the #squad - use it to study the A.C.I.D.'s effects on the Vek.

94bbe521cd1e47913cae8acd1b0acb4f.text: An A.C.I.D. tank has been deployed to this sector. Take out any Vek hit by the tank, then secure the sector so we can study the Vek remains.

3f2ce42a13f53a7471ee56280c39e512.text: Too many Vek escaped the A.C.I.D. test - we don't have enough Vek remains to conduct proper analysis.

89f3781bb18ac83695b51c70f5b550ca.text: A success, commander  with your help, a sufficient number of Vek were inflicted with A.C.I.D. for study.

301918e54934644b08ca86496e7663c6.text: Normal battle, but Vek are jumping out of the ACID pools to attack. They have ACID pre-applied to them as a game effect. (They're adapting? They can live surprisingly long with it?)

a05a0be1919f932faad6e043349e478b.text: These A.C.I.D. pools are being hit by the Vek, but the Vek seem to be... adapting to the chemicals. We need to stop the Vek before they develop an immunity.

36b0a615f82b46cd7d16c305cc74dbd6.text: This sector has several A.C.I.D. storage lakes. The Vek seem to be using them as routes to reach the surface.

6d99c3fb39789670bbdf16455ed93895.text: #squad, you are to be commended - sensors confirm the Vek have been driven back. The sector is once again ours.

7e9443fd73f2ba9f93e08cdd9d8d5a68.text: This sector has two Grid installations that power many of our Detritus' factories. These installations are vital to Detritus' defense efforts.

75f23158ef613510fd020c5c6deadad7.text: The power plants in this sector are critical against the Vek, commander. If lost, we may lose Detritus as well.

094b6bbb59652cc154b55053cbd488ca.text: Both power plants have reported in, and there's been no disruption in the Grid. You and your pilots have our gratitude, commander.

703b928e51799923fceb18279912c020.text: One of the plants was lost. We'll have to initiate energy rationing for all but the most critical facilities, but Detritus may be able to recover.

91fd30f1e7f3beb821261ebc0b50254b.text: The loss of both plants has not only caused our factories to go dark, but several refugee centers as well. I'll need to relocate the people immediately.

923e1d2d25b9316cfd002ed5bf889d5d.text: Normal battle, but the map has massive conveyor belts that push the units around. (Normally used for transporting waste and recycling? Used for transportation of civilians?)

6ed26e8d18744e327e3728db0bc35ba9.text: Normally we use Conveyer Yards to ferry waste vats - but you and the #squad may be able to use the conveyers against the Vek.

a7aeb8161c7f5774eb565425b6b16ef4.text: The Conveyor Yard is secured. Thank you, commander - we had not thought to use the conveyer belts in a military capacity.

6789250c425d560f5d7fb7396707fe8e.text: Normal battle, but the map has teleporter spaces that can warp units between different spaces on the map. (Again, why? Transport of waste/people/tech/etc?)

ab11016d1920c781a1af71155fafad13.text: This is one of our teleporter sites - it transports waste by disassembling and reassembling matter. You may be able to use the teleporters against the Vek.

3d7a7db651d93f2bccb75ccaf707ff76.text: While teleporting biomatter is prohibited by the Corporate Accords, I can make an exception for you - and the Vek.

b6174d5504e065a332684eeff6a2e5ad.text: Disposal teleporters are active in this sector, built to disassemble and transport waste matter. You could use them to outmaneuver the Vek.

59c47cb20fd6c86bf51d0ee5d6eb122c.text: The teleporter site is ours - we will continue to use these teleporters against the Vek if need be.

9ff5d860302490ae1f8dc95750af40d4.text: The site is back under our control - and following your example, we can use the teleporters against the Vek if they attack again.

493b65fe311f8c609142c57323ba122c.text: See below, this is the entry for a generic (A.I.) pilot.

e9c9102ec8ab898399b304e01c4470ce.text: See below, this is the entry for a generic Archive pilot.

462fbe0f3a0d372b274aa377e7f43c34.text: See below, this is the entry for a generic R.S.T. pilot.

9ecaa7178993757a552f149481fb4b2c.text: See below, this is the entry for a generic Pinnacle (A.I.) pilot.

5a9d7072289846e26e4639302041a77b.text: See below, this is the entry for a generic Detritus pilot.

66dbb5914dd52298c9273ebe57d43c5f.text: Ralph Karlsson [Unknown] Ralph has crossed the breach almost more times he can count - there's been at least a hundred timelines he's watched fall (in the opening state, he has yet to save even one). This continuous cycle of warfare has made him ruthlessly efficient, being unwilling to even sleep if he has to, as he feels every second counts... and every second that slips away could be the critical moment lost to the Vek. He's come a long way from the wide-eyed soldier he first was (it seems like several lifetimes ago, and it was), and he tries to avoid attachments to the other pilots, as he knows how likely they are to die in battle. He has never said which island he hails from, and there are suspicions he may have come from somewhere beyond the Corporate archipelago... possibly even from a space station. If true, Ralph has refused to confirm it, although in a few timelines, both Bethany, Harold, and Isaac have commented on the Time Pod's architecture as being modeled off of space-faring tech (notably a launch capsule of a rocket... or an escape pod of a rocket).

26dc82d2d190682b34f07c9b37e4293f.text: Bethany Jones [Pinnacle] Bethany Jones served as a physics engineer at Pinnacle, helping design and refine Pinnacle shield technology. Having only grown up on Pinnacle, she's somewhat sheltered with regards to the other islands, and she tends to trusting of others, taking them at their word. She loves the cold and the snow, but she's also excited by the opportunities to see other islands in the Corporate archipelago and learn from the people there. While she and Isaac are technically brother and sister, there hasn't been a timeline where they both were alive to realize this (either Bethany dies at a young age, or Isaac dies - only one of them could be saved in the womb b/c of a chronic medical condition their parents had). Bethany has had a more positive upbringing than Isaac, and her genius is tempered more with empathy and optimism than Isaac (who had a much more difficult childhood).

ce8bccdf33884089050e13fff7d0076b.text: Abe Isamu [R.S.T.] Sometimes jokingly called "Honest Abe" in previous timelines, nothing could be farther from the truth. Abe served as an "expeditor" (assassin and "black box" work) during the early years of CEO Kern's rise to power, and he took on many names and identities in service to R.S.T. to handle any "difficult issues" that would arise that needed to be dealt with by the corporation. He is ruthless when given an objective (in this case, fighting the Vek), and served as ground support in his original timeline before stealing a Mech from a dying (?) pilot and using its breach technology to escape the timeline after the squad perished in the volcanic island. Since then, "Abe" has followed the orders of his first CEO Kern and is determined to keep fighting until every Vek in every timeline is defeated... a hopeless task, but "Abe" realizes he has little else to fight for, and even if he were to remain in a timeline he saved, he could not deal with the idea that other timelines were still in jeopardy. He has yet to encounter his duplicate, and if so, he may not recognize them due to surgery and the fluctuation of identities his job required before the Vek attack.

a53aa50bdbc9b2443e69a3aaf6067516.text: Harold Schmidt [Archive] Harold is as close as they come to an engineering "sociopath" (this is not the clinical term - co-workers in previous timelines used to call him a "technopath," but even that's not an accurate term for his lack of empathy and social skills). He finds humans uncomfortable and confusing, and takes solace in tinkering with robotics and machines who have clear rulesets and reasons for what they do. In his original timeline, he served a brief term at Detritus (where he seemed bored and uncommunicative), then was rejected from Pinnacle due to his psychological exam, then found a home in Archive, studying and doing restoration work on Old Earth robotics. He initially applied to Archive's open-call for pilot training so it could get him closer to the Mech technology, then it was discovered he did well on the pilot exam (better than most Archive volunteers), and he agreed to serve as a soldier as a way of giving him access to the cutting edge of Mech technology. (Note that Harold doesn't bear any ill-will toward Detritus and Pinnacle, nor do they bear him any ill-will... however, both Singh's predecessor and Zenith saw Harold's lack of empathy, and were worried it could lead to accidents or disregard for human life while he was carrying out his duties.)

2c8adc95263de3ff49cd1152f3691d56.text:
Prospero [Detritus] In its original timeline, Prospero was a recycler robot from Detritus. Its job was to monitor region safety in Detritus disposal sites, but was severely damaged in a disposal accident (this was in the days before Vikram was CEO). The "recycled recycler" robot was sold at a discount to Archive as a groundskeeper for some of the nature preserves, and it seemed to take to the work, translating its knowledge of chemistry and recycling technology to help cultivate gardens (and when it wasn't able to do this, it would devour all books on botany, biology, and even spiritual books related to nurturing and growing of all life forms). It would have likely have remained a quiet hulking gardener were it not for the emergence of the Vek. When the Vek erupted on Archive, the robot followed its directives to protect the nature preserves and saw the Vek as nothing more than garden pests to be eliminated to protect the plants. When Archive was able to send reinforcements to the region, they found Prospero still quietly tending its garden, now fertilized with Vek corpses. 

Much like Gana, Prospero is viewed with some suspicion due to the robot uprising, but like Gana, Prospero follows orders and has proven itself on many occasions. When traversing to a new timeline, Prospero seems to actively avoid returning to Detritus. The reason for this is unknown.

03b38dcc3b1e82adc5612bd46eb8f716.text: Lily Reed [Archive] Lily was an orphan found at sea at the age of seven (she's now 20), then found and raised by Archive when her makeshift life raft came in sight of their island. Lily was only newly-employed at Archive before she answered the open call for pilot training - some employees may have frowned at her sudden shift in career were it not for the urgency to find soldiers to fight the Vek. Unlike others at Archive who wished to slowly tinker with the Mechs, she embraced her training whole-heartedly, soon learning to use the Mech with one of the fastest training times of any Archive pilot on record. Lily's gone through only a few timelines (or maybe just one) and even seeing the end of the world hasn't dulled her enthusiasm for stopping the Vek. She is a talented pilot and engineer, and her near-hyperactive energy has found a good outlet on the battlefield.

7a5d3140728298140e422e3c86e47dcb.text: Chen Rong [Detritus] Chen is Henry Kwan's opposite. He's dutiful, conscientious, and puts other's safety before his own. Chen was a high-level manager of one of the key Teleportation Waste Sites in Detritus (much like a central hub to distribute waste to the proper sections of the island), and was responsible for transporting and managing hundreds of disposal lines at once (much like an air traffic controller in the old days, but this was governing the movement of waste, junk, and insuring there were no back-ups or stoppages in the supply line). It is believed this gave him considerable skill in tactics that was recognized during the open call for pilots when the Vek first attacked. Unlike Kwan, Rong didn't volunteer because he wanted to fight, or rise above his position, he did it because he believed it was his responsibility. Since then, he has proven a capable and reliable solider, although he lacks Kwan's battle instincts.

7c0fd0d6940629049c7dc966558577a4.text: Henry Kwan [Detritus] Henry Kwan is perhaps the least reliable and least safety-minded worker in Detritus. It seemed he would be forever regulated to a low-level A.C.I.D. report-filing bureau at Detritus - until the Vek attacked. Impulsively, he applied for the open call for pilot training, and he passed the aptitude test with flying colors (his instincts and reflexes seemed to shine in "think-fast" situations - as well as situations where he could cause a lot of damage... intentionally.). While hardly the most modest employee at Detritus, his accomplishments in battle have only fed his ego. Despite the timelines lost, Henry seems to see it all as some sort of game, and remains distant from the actual suffering - some suspect his jokes and boasting are a psychological shield, and thus, are afraid to pierce it, in case he loses what gives him his fighting confidence in the first place by dwelling on his failures vs. his accomplishments.

30ed59316c57d540d66cef340c66813b.text: Camila Vera [R.S.T.] Camila is the sixth adopted daughter of Jessica Kern (who maintains an extended family of 20, none of them related by blood) from her Origin Timeline. She is a ex-cartographer and meteorological scout from R.S.T. - she was previously assigned to do field surveys and do "terrain testing" in areas where the corporation were testing out new terraforming weapons (she was essentially terraforming "Q.A."). In this role, she became an excellent pilot (the others are dead, it's an unforgiving job) and developed a "sixth sense" for piloting craft in hazardous conditions and trusting her instincts to "move" whenever she sensed a quake or collapse in the ground was about to occur. She has since channeled this sixth sense into combat, learning to anticipate and evade Vek webs as well as knowing how to pilot her Mech in the thickest dust storms without handicapping her combat efficiency. She was one of the first volunteers to fight the Vek in her original timeline after the death of her adopted mother, and also (she's never revealed this to anyone else) she has always had a loathing for insects, so she takes satisfaction in wiping out the giant varieties (the Vek).

32709476d283edfcc52af078b0ad4b95.text:
Gana [Archive] Gana is a construction robot adapted for combat by uploading a mix of old and modern combat routines from the Archive libraries (think Baymax in Big Hero 6). This has had partial success, and what happened to Gana is evidence as to why he was the only construction robot so outfitted: while an excellent soldier, his expressions and outlook are a blend of construction-focused speech mixed with ruthless pragmatism. As an example, Gana may categorize an otherwise simple repair as "offending parts have been executed" - or he may start ordering a building's infrastructure to "hold the line" to prevent a collapse. Soldiers who have served with Gana for an extended period of time have come to ignore its unusual speech patterns as the robot is incredibly effective on the field (and obeys orders), but Gana can be disconcerting for new pilots. Gana has indicated that when the war with the Vek is over, he would prefer to return to his construction duties, and finds he experiences "reduced job satisfaction" in fighting the Vek. 

Note that given the recent rise in prejudice against the Pinnacle robots, Gana has suffered similar discrimination and several officers have questioned if Gana's "sanity" in case he may malfunction like the Pinnacle robots.

084951f0efc06434176639932078a67c.text:
Isaac [Pinnacle] Isaac has seen too many timelines collapse, and seen too many permutations for how things can go wrong - his high intelligence actually works against him, rather than makes him more confident because he can imagine all the ways things can go wrong (think Chidi Anagonye in The Good Place). He feels ill-suited for being a soldier (his squad mates usually agree, but his scientific knowledge is indispensable). 

While he and Bethany are technically brother and sister, there hasn't been a timeline where they both were alive to realize this (either Bethany dies at a young age, or Isaac dies - only one of them could be saved in the womb b/c of a chronic medical condition their parents had). He respects machines and sees them as equals due to being raised on Pinnacle (he has faith in Zenith, perhaps too much as he feels she's too intelligent to do anything wrong).

Isaac is as much of a genius as his sister, although self-doubt weakens him. He has considerable knowledge of aeronautics, physics, gravitation theory and manipulation, and a number of other fields. It is likely Isaac could master any science he chose to, his only block is his own perceived limitations.

3c797136f20ad419214864298258dd2b.text:
Silica [R.S.T.] Silica is a hybrid of Pinnacle and R.S.T. technology, believed to be one of the first (and possibly only) artificial intelligences devoted to terrain architecture. 

In "his" original timeline, Silica was responsible for first detecting and studying the Vek, and eventually was modified to investigate their hives... this nearly ended catastrophically, and Silica was recovered and his programming altered from terraforming to terraforming-based-combat... the concept of using the existing terrain and shaping it, exploiting it, and using the surrounding region as a weapon against the Vek. 

When Silica jumped timelines, his original programming was unknown to every subsequent timeline, and they have seen him only in his role as a environmental tactician, designed to help the islands defeat the Vek.

a176ed57da6a731c7b6945898975770c.text:
Archimedes [Pinnacle] Archimedes is a cutting-edge robotic intelligence (a Sentient, he finds the term "robot" and "artificial" to be discriminatory) from Pinnacle designed to act as a Human Relations officer. It has come from a timeline where Pinnacle "oversaw" the islands (the Pinnacle Island Network: P.I.N.) and tended to the humans' needs (much like how you would take care of animals on a farm, but not in a mean or ruthless way  the Sentients simply saw themselves as benevolent caretakers to keep the humans from hurting themselves). 

Zenith has refused to allow Archimedes access to her network, for fear that his directives may corrupt programming on Pinnacle (if this occurred it would be inadvertent, but it is a possibility). Archimedes believes the rioting behavior of the robots on Pinnacle is due to either (1) a contradictory directive they are attempting to follow or reconcile, or (2) the possibility that the arrival of sentient pilot variants from other timelines may indeed be interfering with the natural programmatic order on the island.

2cfd8c315b8473566b5276eec323443d.text:
The Mantis are an alien race from the game FTL. Generic text is used to streamline these pilots for use in the game. Kazaaakpleth is a secret pilot that can be gained over the course of the game.

General Background: The Mantis exist to expand, loot, and plunder. There are males and females of the species. They once enslaved the Engi (and thus, may have an overseer-like dominance toward their Mech). They are expansionist, tribal, warlike, and polytheistic. Females often don't make it to high positions of authority unless they are particularly vicious.

The Mantis at key points in their life, have to either return home to reform their exoskeletons (non-biological materials adhere to a resin secreted by their epidermal layers) - or to a suitable planet with the same materials. The Earth of Into the Breach is one such planet although it's not clear if the Mantis were aware of that. Their ships are also composed of the same crust as the Mantis "wear." Presumably this crust can be applied to Mech hulls as well (not planning to discuss/show in game, merely commenting this). Mantis ship hulls may also be bedecked with hides, corpses, and remains of their kills. The Mantis enjoy teleporter technology in hunting prey (teleporting onto ships) and are comfortable with the technology (but the Breach tech may be more primitive than they're used to).

Specific Background: Kazaaakpleth is feared among his own people because he doesn't hunt aliens... he prefers to hunt his own kind. He outwardly claims to be doing this for bounties and for a higher, noble purpose, but secretly, he enjoys killing other Mantis. His craft is an escape pod from a failed encounter with a tribe of his own people he'd marked for death. His craft detected the beacon from Earth, and followed it to the corporate islands. He soon relalized he'd come to the "Happy Hunting Grounds" a place where he can practice his fighting skills on larger varities of insects than ever (the Vek) and a machine (his Mech) that he can use as a weapon. Kazaaakpleth is happy to slay as many Vek as he can, although if he had the skill to build a ship and take to the stars with the technology he has found, he would do so. Like Mantis, do, K. needs to reestablish his carapace, and he finds the islands rich with suitable biological material - including Vek corpses.

dcd792e61396e391e981dae81c97da67.text:
The Zoltan are an alien race from the game FTL. Generic text is used to streamline these pilots for use in the game. Mafan is a secret pilot that can be gained over the course of the game.

General Background: The Zoltan are a wise, intelligent species of energy, about to transcend to a higher "level"  of consciousness. They favor enlightenment above all else. They are respectful, tactful, and humble but not pushovers if attacked. Younger members ("children") in the lore are said to be gaining telepathic powers. 

Specific Background: Mafan was on a pilgrimage when the beacon summoned it. It finds the idea of the breaches to be akin to enlightenment along the lines of Groundhog Day although it finds them surprising it considers the two week "recycling" of the self an opportunity to reflect on one's actions forever within an enclosed temporal loop. It considers the Vek to be an obstruction to this enlightenment, but also a necessary part of the phenomenon that keeps sparking the breaches to be made. (More specifics about the tone and intent of each of the lines below can be found in the Writing Style Guide, broken down line by line, if curious  it gives more information on how Mafan and the Zoltan might perceive certain events.)

7b552847ff80412b69e32cb1fec409a0.text:
The Rock (People) are an alien race from the game FTL. Generic text is used to streamline these pilots for use in the game. Ariadne is a secret pilot that can be gained over the course of the game.

General Background: Rock (people, male and females of the species exist) are large, herbivorous bipeds. Rock(men) are natural isolationists and like to be left alone. They are dogmatic and single-minded. In their own territories, they are largely religious zealots and have a wide interpretation of cultural transgression (ex: offers to trade can be interpreted as hostile). Rock(men) are raised so that radical members of their species are separated from the population and carefully managed so that they can fit in with the rest of their culture. Interaction with alien species is illegal. Their home culture involve arranged marriages. They were one of the founders of the Federation (along with humans and Engi). 

Rockmen who do not conform to their species stereotype (say, rebelling against religion or by being simply... different) can be found amongst the stars, and several instances of Rock pirates and warriors exist in the Big Black (they are known to cover their ships with "outcast decorations"). 

Specific Background: Ariadne (female of the species) was fleeing a pre-arranged marriage to a Basilisk Chief (see FTL) when the beacon diverted her vessel. Her crime prevents her from wanting to return to Rock space even if she could... but is uncomfortable amongst the many cultures on the new planet she has found. She is vaguely curious what time travel/breach technology could possibly do to erase her crime and the events leading up to it, allowing for a fresh start.

6b92eed5a1dd9560f079f598538899de.text: See CEO biography in narrative documentation.

7bc9fa7fd34b780f8b8dcb53d49a7c20.text: Artificial pilots are assigned to mechs as a last resort in combat. While they are capable of fighting, Mechs excel and become better when manned by a human pilot (or Pinnacle A.I., which are far more advanced). Artificial pilots are often present in the corporate islands, but not accorded the same status nor have the same extent of personality that the Pinnacle robots do.

1e76c339321ce480928585ebb0331583.text: These fellows are a little uncertain, but interested in the Mechs they are commanding from an Archive point of view.

4f1c6b3fa81ff78a4d111e7f1541f772.text: R.S.T. pilots are no-nonsense and share much of Kerns' aggressive pragmatism. They tend to be harsher than the other Island pilots and have a ruthless streak. Sometimes stiff and military ("commander"), but at other times, their eagerness at killing Vek comes out.

7dcc667a5c4b903654b7f5917826f03d.text: Pinnacle are all A.I.s/Sentients, just to reinforce the robotic theme (even though there are humans on the island).

e4ddfb46768dd174559b6ba5869f1653.text: Detritus pilots are cautious, careful (both due to their profession), and polite - they, like their CEO, believe in safety first and "disposing" of hazardous material (including Vek) safely vs. swiftly. They are more matter-of-fact and focus on metrics and results. "Haste makes waste" is a good Old Earth expression for explaining their slow, methodical approach.

9071b3468e8fd3277442206d674112ce.text: Classic cold knowledgeable veteran type. No time for those who can't keep up. Cynical/realistic about your chances. Not a very exaggerated character.

7c8245207ff4d3504b82c7b0adc92cb1.text: Caring, intelligent, pragmatic. A bit naive to war. Constantly hopeful & encouraging. Looks for the best in humanity.

345fbf042db18267172a67301d1a1989.text: Inquisitive; Focused on learning more than just fighting. Easily distracted. Somewhat disinterested and uncaring. Not very empathic.

196da1ba2d09583fe769c2c181cd4b78.text: Prospero has been repurposed to operate its Mech in harsh conditions. Its English is fine but isn't in love with the new "work" conditions.

8947ba3c7106205e16d559692a0fca55.text: Really excited. Hopeful and a little silly. Feels invulnerable. Sees it as a game.

bba94bbd05baccf3cb711077d9ca4ffa.text: Chen is conscientious, reliable, and tries to be a model soldier. He's one of the best examples of managerial skill and leadership at Detritus, and it comes through in fighting the Vek.

51309c154ba3ab4d6a83ff355a646ffd.text: Cocky. Feels he is the hero. Feels invulnerable. Feels he couldn't possibly be wrong.

e1685593b7cc628821e77c759368fe35.text: Prototypical good soldier. Treats the battle like a military war. Doesn't have time for nonsense. Wishes others were as professional. While she shares traits with Chen Rong, they occasionally (quietly) clash on military issues (she's more hands-on in the fighting, while Rong's more of a supervising officer).

3cd9993c95f25731e8945b4e7215dc08.text: Construction robot adapted for military use. Meant to interface with people so speaks in sentences but is very curt and unemotional.

2aa9c57eb2084788502d1cd6ab4b17dc.text: Paranoid & pessimistic. Generally a good person but not handling all the stress well, and his attitude can sometimes be demoralizing - he's suspicious of his own successes and victories. Definitely a "this timeline's already half-lost" kind of guy. Stutters because of temporal research studies... it's caused a nervous system problem in his speech patterns.

74db7e0ad67178da589ad5ac91cb61d6.text: A relatively calm, pragmatic machine who has adjusted to the change in its original purpose of mineral survey to destruction. It tends to quantify its responses in terms of how actions will affect the environment first, then the individuals second.

3c3d97716e39fefe317f16ea28bcfee2.text: Well-mannered, aristocratic, superior (he comes from a more advanced timeline, he believes), and can be condescending toward humans.

6b64c1695a293a45abafa102648eb1a6.text: Mantis speak in a kind of chittering - (i.e. names having a lot of k's or tch's kinda sounds).

da8bc51c4c4e79c0d64190ca78259a0e.text: Zoltan are energy beings so perhaps a wispy ethereal speak.

c01ac88388dbaa42c51fc99e252f9613.text: Rock people "speech" is like a low grumble - slower, almost a 'rocks grinding' sound.

6ca47be4dfc53f79893bddff0d1f47b3.text: This happens at the start of a new game

8e381fe415ce2f6798ff5553a5c67939.text: I'm back... and there's Archive, restored! Still, that won't last if I don't stop the Vek.

8bad500feed1f7b33492d6c259c52273.text: There it is - the island chain being hit by the Vek invasion. Sensors confirm R.S.T. is holding the line. For now.

ac81cdc76a6502099d3597e087c5ff79.text: [ Att: Pinnacle CEO: Zenith. This is #self_reverse, from compromised timeline. My databank holds records critical to human and robot survival ]

6ec0da274f49732701e0a5c2715f2b2d.text: There's Detritus, before the catastrophe. Maybe we can apply my combat data to ridding these islands of the Vek contamination.

ccd50025cd7d53e0b3cff1f934935e6f.text: These corporate islands are the Vek's breeding ground. Wipe them out here, we save the world.

650d0dc9834043b69afe92884ab5ef81.text: No way in hell I'm letting the Vek take the islands this time.

df06e78b0574dc6a501e48590ad18458.text: This timeline'll be a Vek graveyard.

cd3337d88ab937b9e16d57d13e4bd456.text: We'll hold this timeline, no matter what.

0c1159036fa3548a84be23a8c44ea447.text: I was given another chance to save the world - it all depends on these islands. I can do this!

ddd154366167f4f1fc55ae844e5e0b47.text: I am not here to save you. I am here to train you to save yourselves.

ab6e8b43a59a5164ee8953b473263c85.text: Without determination and strength, these islands will fall again. Stand with me or stay out of my way.

11dfeb8c00760fc062c85e43687233d1.text: Our strategy remains the same: defend these islands. However, I wonder... is anything different in this timeline?

bd3691bbbfee63a8d1611d93df45dc22.text: I wonder... were any significant technological divergences in this timeline? I suppose we'll see in the battles ahead!

f7ee5d54756d52ea0570e55cdd63fed1.text: I'm back - almost as if nothing happened. How long can this cycle continue?

0fd416ea44be95f02eb1e7e773445512.text: I wonder... are these breaches causing any damage to the timeline? The tachyon emissions alone...

a970c58b16227e4ca2c33ba452773990.text: Detecting high concentrations of carnivorous insects infesting all corporate islands. Activating Vekticide protocols.

650db71cdc29612dee1468178ae28418.text: Vek parasites have infested the environmental preserves on the islands. I shall rectify this.

f0572d0012e753b445a75bfc2869679e.text: These islands are my gardens. As I tend the gardens, Vek remains shall nourish the soil.

59a17dbd92bdba081f5d440871e4b184.text: These island biomes are threatened by Vek. I shall see to it their remains feed the soil.

f9bad0aa59f0a530b2a1578552a19894.text: Here we go! Another chance to save the world!

ddc8e1155a5ce6a67d71a5e27bc447bf.text: Hello...? Did I make it? Oh... picking up signals from the islands now. Hello, out there!

4faf2d8d6e7bb2ddba6b1ab5dbd89044.text: Let me know you need from me, commander. I can help organize the islands into a fighting force against the Vek, just say the word.

54bb7b7e5c34cdbdc786c1ed35f2c45a.text: We don't have much time. Every second the islands waste debating the threat, the Vek gain more ground.

307f68d72e6d5b82ec351ade57f196b5.text: Good citizens of the islands - no need to be afraid! I, #self_full have come to destroy the Vek!

8c91dbee338d379a1b1ba9dc2c447053.text: People of the islands, I am here - from the future! I have come in your hour of need to... anyone? Is this thing on?

8654102e632f981e7f8d34e80620e66f.text: Another timeline, another opportunity for #self_full to shine!

3d4620557cd3b80b0d6b69c0dc54c185.text: All right, listen up. Our primary objective is to hold these islands. We do that, we might just have a chance at winning this war.

015b9677c9ec7c2331bef87a61bcb81d.text: Have to learn from the mistakes I made in the last timeline... if so, then maybe R.S.T. will survive.

3f53229794ef02824d88a633ea5e88e9.text: There's R.S.T., and it looks like my foster mother is alive in this timeline... but there's no trace of me. I wonder if Kern ever knew me?

54f1c724137c55c6e958f6b9f7f1dabb.text: First order of business. We need to roll out Mech production and prioritize weapons manufacturing... what are you all standing around for? Move!

eaefb3116f312f8c6b45549492ed23a3.text: Islands, this is #self_reverse. I am here because your timeline requires extensive repairs. Exterminating the Vek is a necessary first step.

f4d232edd84a1c053e59e125af5f6761.text: Islands, this is #self_reverse. There are many like me, but I am unique. I am here as your ally. Without me, you will go extinct.

7d34cf30b2490a7171598acc4ed0de00.text: All sentient systems, I am #self_reverse. You are threatened. We will act together to end this threat.

997e62af9ec2dc5e1560708def277c73.text: S-s-so many deaths, and I'm b-b-back as if nothing happened... w-w-will there ever be an end to this?

5cf20a362025a644a738eef1b695605e.text: S-s-same islands as before - and the s-s-same war. Isn't it madness to keep r-r-repeating one's actions?

e15a9eaff46b86faf5b47bb05c59c9e4.text: P-P-Pardon my stutter, it's a side effect of my research. W-would it be possible to reserve some lab s-s-space?

a910000dbf412b5b9c1dc41e80c6fd51.text: B-B-Back again... is it p-p-possible we're perpetuating this war? Even creating n-n-new timelines?

d9374d8eb3843d8cd36cfda5698c3ffe.text: The Vek are conducting unauthorized mining in this archipelago. I am here to stop their efforts.

9baf02ced0253d300ad957a63aa64d64.text: Pinnacle is regulated to a single island in this timeline. Current overseer: Zenith a THIRD-generation intelligence? How archaic.

9061ef348342354dc3b62cf0ad80221e.text: No wonder this timeline is in danger. Humans are running around everywhere, completely off their designated preserves.

71dd94078c116ba98edd172622d4a035.text: No sign of the Pinnacle Island Network... why, it looks as if Pinnacle has restricted itself to a single island. Why have they not taken control?

efbc14e158622799da2a8ee6e34a298d.text: Happens on the island screen after finding the FTL pilot in a pod.

8a18ac24659ce406a1d54bec44939065.text: Uh... that Pod... ship... whatever it is... has an occupant. Can't make out what it's saying, but it seems... friendly?

e0907d88fa4480aa71285d970479149a.text: There's... something inside the Pod, commander. It's communicating, but what, I don't know.

29d3cff880a4ab6f40ab878258a81446.text: [ Alien craft contains extraterrestrial occupant and language of unknown construction ]

b5e3a1242fb3a4e4e9a29bcc84baf60f.text: Craft has a pilot, but I can't decode what it's saying.

6831b346bcdc318fbd2c49eff77bf4fa.text: Who... or what this thing is, my systems can't translate what it's saying.

00d9d3faeaa5909c6b7552e1612c104c.text: I... think it's an extraterrestrial, but I can't seem to translate its language.

041cbf47a536549c96325a3f40414700.text: The land this pilot comes from is unknown, but not of earth.

eceff565baf504c3b2e1b7c6d919ba5a.text: Why... I believe it's an extraterrestrial! Having trouble with its language, however.

78b1f6fda4ce1e6bdc496e8934a77cdf.text: The pilot is unaware of the damage done to the soil by their landing, but their actions seem allied with ours.

db91a9e2a1e2dee36a394e164b9143fe.text: It's an alien! Let's make it feel at home! Er, whatever home's like for them, I guess?

6f8883db808d65762ad16fb5473e38a8.text: Looks like our new friend came from space... can't make heads or tails of what it's saying, though.

1de16930676c71bc6b7eab04abfdf8de.text: Whoever... or whatever this thing is, it's speaking gibberish.

c396b68955e0c45b56b790c9e8fda6e6.text: Whatever this pilot is, my systems can't translate what it's saying, commander.

230db840e1cbe57c1559034983c265e2.text: The pilot's craft bears no tachyon emissions. Its language is unknown to my circuits.

075582f39a4e3246443277b245118223.text: I... th-th-think the craft and pilot are alien! C-can't seem to t-t-translate its language, though.

878f1db5733a37361713161646f60c97.text: The pilot's craft bears no tachyon emissions. It... may even be more advanced than I am.

3ddd0d72b7faee3321d2be92c226a6c5.text: Happens after you start a new game with an FTL pilot. Only needed for Recruits

215d35c5c64e82c87c1bec4083bc9f74.text: Why would the future send us an alien that can't communicate with us?

7765ed7f2d8c2eaa46962797228b7a6d.text: I think it's trying to communicate, commander... at least it seems like it wants to help.

ab7bdd82840d76cedf6bafd8a6b1534b.text: [ Extraterrestrial time traveler is speaking a language of unknown construction ]

bf70c315ee989d48710cbaa5afdf261c.text: It appears this alien time traveler is going to lead the charge against the Vek.

aab18db24ca3312670568c00aaefef07.text: Start of new game after winning

4350a2bc9280ecaafc7b40d4b53443c6.text: So... attention, islands, I'm #self_full, and I've fought the Vek before - and won. I'm here to do it again!

89d0fdd34dc994fb9f38953facf470fd.text: Commander? Commander, is that you? Oh, thank god. I was worried I'd get some Archive rookie. So... uh... I'm here about your Vek problem.

1ceadd6ddcbfa2e6d6a5ab5637f15fff.text: [ Att: Pinnacle CEO: Zenith. This is #self_reverse, from a salvaged timeline. My databank holds records critical to victory over the Vek ]

4975f0bbb3e9935520080035ab64e35f.text: Time to rid these islands of the Vek contamination all over again.

56617b0aade35ba718c0a5bce6aab15a.text: I wonder if the Vek clean-up will be any easier the second time around...

bc1b3ae9f281ab9bb74f811e7a79738b.text: We beat the Vek before, we can do it again. And every timeline we save, we can send more pilots to other timelines.

2b2f6de8fae648568164b80a295451e8.text: Time to save the world again!

368386a01e571f1e2e0e165a4d983aa3.text: I saved the world once, I can do it again.

a0e42bedec4ae219c1402e057dbc2ebf.text: I hope the other Pilots got to their own timelines safely...

b9146844ea50b37015dd500dfc2a87df.text: The future repeats. And if so, victory is assured.

98064adb176c8f43e1cfd90cf050dfde.text: Do... sorry, getting ahead of myself, but... can we beat the Vek without going to the volcano this time? I don't like that part.

23ad6c38233a3f8f75f6b37dbd73e8d7.text: Well, looks like we have another Vek situation here... time to roll up the sleeves and get my hands dirty.

064bf869abc4218c93e939efa7626e0c.text: I do hope I get to meet Dr. Renfield in this timeline and say what a success his bomb was in the last timeline!

14add18d9e05664879cb795b9df125c6.text: I shall tend to these island gardens as before until the Vek are no more.

3d50cafb7badc81d69f4a75ce88bb4ce.text: The remains of the Vek shall once again enrich the soul with their nutrients.

d8aba05e52bfe1507e45592db0fb25d1.text: The moment of my awakening in my origin timeline was there, on Archive. Its gardens need me again.

8bcbe187ec4418be5fd9918f03814e8e.text: Though forged on Detritus, Archive is my home. I will tend to it across every timeline, as before.

d96fd87442293f15428270a623b3e140.text: It's the islands again... but no volcanic one, good! Hello, islands? It's #self_full, here to help!

0997301f43dc0757dbb18460d76200b8.text: Can't let the last victory get to my head. We could lose it all again in a heartbeat.

9cc8c298582d3bff8122fb3d128a970f.text: Time to save the world again! This time with a little more style than the LAST timeline, that's for sure.

61ea26d9bcac4cb5bda6d0a4892fb25e.text: Still riding high from defeating the Vek... I wish everyone in this timeline had seen me pull that off!

78ce9d0191dbedc69715e19e819064f3.text: I saved the world before, I can do it again, no problem! <Cracks knuckles> So which island wants to be first?

72e69be02d29bcbf0fa3ba768207e390.text: A second timeline... and another chance to save it like we did before. I can do this. WE can do this.

810ad185424186a868ba6515c238e8da.text: Commander, I am Officer #self_full. I'm here from a previous timeline where we defeated the Vek. I'm here to help.

d8762c3b3b05da65a06b997f4a9a16f2.text: Islands, this is #self_reverse. I have repaired a previous timeline's Vek damage. I will now do the same to yours.

bbd90ee4ff474305f3b5e3a3a5c50764.text: Islands, this is #self_reverse. I am from a timeline where the Vek population was violently extracted. I will now do the same to yours.

cb2bfbf72e8eca5285f69fc55e834946.text: Islands, this is #self_reverse. I have saved a similar timeline from the Vek. Together, we will expunge the Vek from this one as well.

95f3d6d6840e4469470840157ab2f320.text: I am #self_reverse. I have come to this timeline to forcibly eradicate your Vek hives. Please send your leader to me for further instructions.

7c52d9b4dac3aba7044c9adeb770262a.text: I...Why, I'm speaking normally. Is this the result of the last breach? Or the fact we won?

3edc2a5389f65403962d9da654b78ee0.text: Pardon my stutter... wait. My voice, it's normal. Um... ahem. Can I speak to someone in charge?

8c68b8982838f4340be0cee30e9ae65b.text: I... I hope to one day travel to a timeline already freed of the Vek. It seems it is not this time.

8199c3b1d04a808036e15b85309f5742.text: M-my stutter... it faded for a bit. I wonder why? Was it the because we defeated the Vek in the last timeline?

e942946e7716378bb2bf843f039bf3c5.text: Islands... Pinnacle, R.S.T.... Archive... this is #self_full, Doctor #self_full. I... I can help you against the Vek.

095e2242ecf4a1c8b69e79de03709f74.text: Island citizens... I come from a timeline where the Vek were beaten - and carry research concerning the breach.

9632a4583e713bf4925ace07852f4678.text: The volcanic island has not yet surfaced in this timeline. We must provoke the Vek until it emerges.

d8206ac9ffba83c0caef5c43468dd556.text: Preparing Vek countermeasures used in previous timeline to increase probability of victory.

561405ca8982033e3c0e56094d8d46ff.text: No sign of the Pinnacle Island Network here, either. Contacting island communications now and uploading Vek victory data.

c5a5ef494ea88a11a0cd9efdcfeb5583.text: If this unit is dead, but gets repaired

f1dcc347bd801eb9a0b88dd2b4fcb494.text: I'm back. CEO Kern didn't give me permission to die.

764b6f27388da714337e0200549ee1a8.text: [ Att: Commander. Reporting successful reactivation following a system failure ]

866ec9911afda6bf64732a22568a6ba3.text: I just need to run some safety checks, and I'm back in the fight.

84e2a61f06e643cec997eafafcbc47b7.text: I... I'm back. Just need a moment to get my bearings.

98c20f9cc1b41e85d84cada6f3ec84cc.text: I have returned, and I am ready.

1993ec76d6c2a9a3334213d4ec05ecc8.text: How... how long was I out?

95a25ca45a28bbdbfdfed6be7a812bab.text: My hibernation cycle has been interrupted.

ac04f56937ddeed51a8848313d2a107b.text: My life cycle has been rebooted.

a96170e6f02614213c54fb5071db05c6.text: I awaken... again. Does the Vek infestation remain?

062fe05a1a04fe6794ca976137021ef2.text: What... what happened? Did I get knocked out?

566ddfd93838ef51a00853563d3f5790.text: Ooooh... my head is killing me!

cfbad4128a2693a47357b4684220430f.text: For the record - these things need airbags.

11eafb1bca73c105a0ca7dfec352bdbe.text: Did... did I get knocked out? What happened?

ec1c9d582567a5c647783753ecf27f26.text: ...I hope the cameras were off when I got disabled.

21910dd49b933db3eb221236df448b47.text: Power... restored. Why, how embarrassing. Was I out long?

e2eaf549932e09e0a4b150b9bddf48bb.text: It was an honor to serve, commander.

c8f2a128a153b3766cab3e4b935ae540.text: [ Att: Zenith. #self_reverse, transmitting designation no. and Timeline of Death to Pinnacle archives ]

3dd98eb84e6ac4e34cab06d0f7143c83.text: Tell CEO Singh I did my best.

7efc6cf4d721ce2eebf1186658971f67.text: Don't forget what I taught you...

004db6a86fbbb9acd230a616980ec00c.text: Knew this timeline would be my last...

eca31e8963ecd4d28b52a3287cff16d4.text: Mom, I'm coming to join you now.

bee19b048eb9c2ca53a46fbe33f5c096.text: If you find me in a parallel universe... give him... my research notes...

7798bda84ce3cc2094653df1377b5711.text: I hoped to fix this timeline...

b84f0bcbc3cfde1dc04fa403454db1a2.text: All systems have completed their life cycles.

63957b37e9780e6aa38fd3ffd7b3837c.text: A request: Do not bury me on Detritus.

cf44cd1439102384b2c3d8e13e85daa8.text: Recycle my components so other Mechs may continue the fight.

8063296fcf2b801a1d5a356a295784a5.text: No way... I'm not supposed to die...

9477846a5b9b375c92383aa9973a1eb4.text: So... this is how I die...

3d9e8961c29f957017dbc0c4f6c5327e.text: ...Tell Kern I fought to the end.

7664f44562d2f03cb07d9f5e3be09e99.text: Systems surrendering on multiple fronts. Attempting system morale reboot.

3a65aba4fc558d0942a410ce98ff807b.text: Primary systems have mutinied. I repeat, systems have m...

0609c1a4c6955bcd3e1156639b7a8cb9.text: #self_mech has failed to protect primary occupant. Formal reprimand submitted.

c1c27dfcbfff6603fd85fef5efee4ad1.text: Primary systems report they have not gone gently into the dark night.

6dbb03c2a500e03a05306ce64ce7297f.text: Processors have failed in their primary objectives. Executing traitorous circuits now.

fcee52fe81f8cef767c26fab3a636ce5.text: Reporting dereliction of duty in multiple critical systems. Collapse imminent.

e21207aa3aabbd6042d2823ed4da9af7.text:
If another unit dies.
Use #main to say the dying unit's name.

d7ea70c6d842db227553f49493e8bcdc.text: Detritus will see to it your sacrifice is not forgotten.

827ac9610742822b3a61d0eef29868a2.text: Dammit. We can't give in now!

98655a51a824a8d7a07c5c5b118cc906.text: I'll make them pay for that.

68939acbe18d06497ac220ccc9271a73.text: My gardening tasks increase as my allies fall.

ffc965862dd6764b20199427025bb9c4.text: May your remains feed the soil - and your Mech oxidize in the air.

dc5fe947500fe7d62b7e7abccdd1e437.text: It is not death, #main_full, you are being recycled.

2770decf958123aa4f7844e6a1581b82.text: No no no... This wasn't supposed to happen!

9711227de9a06148997d4363852b184c.text: Dammit! I'm not losing anyone else!

d8b377d00ea5dfd83dbff4af861b761a.text: If only #main_first had listened to me, they wouldn't have died!

1d42714a4ccc0748c0a2aaa16e301bf1.text: Dammit, #main_first! I ordered you not to die!

85c630d39613bfd4ed9256f35c47308e.text: Pilot down! I want no more mistakes!

02d5a4a01cace939712dc0e4f5e69149.text: Everyone, focus! We can't lose anyone else!

8a404abf9c4522f992df279f7bd9d05b.text: No artificial pilot reported inside #main_mech. Loss to #squad: minimal.

f088a36fc3a2da5274a22fb3b502845f.text: Pilot's parts have failed in their primary mission to protect their host.

457968d66cc6ae8b203294910321cc97.text: #main_mech's parts have failed in their primary mission to protect their host.

0b558e5b581a967a7f134523d25ae4ac.text: #main_mech has been deemed unfit for active duty.

b87ff586bb4e771eba6d6104e3d25e27.text: #main_mech has failed to protect its host. Requesting Mech be disciplined.

753c145bb1c840be2904795382fd31f8.text: When w-w-will all this fighting end?

87e147288c21b0f2e44359924e1da3c9.text: My god... the Mech isn't moving. And no life s-s-signs from the cockpit.

9af76c7471a57b4d9f9a41285acea1f9.text: It's hard to lose a soldier, but focus on the mission!

b3ca1dc15b8483ad63b07800adb29fab.text: Another life the Vek will answer for.

75312f40f98722ec5515e5c72272f795.text: No longer reading life signs for Pilot #main_second. Your loss is felt by all.

5695a39b1a710bada2881bccf58b97af.text: We mourn your pilot's loss, commander.

fd3b4955ef792cdb138835dc0c58c09e.text: No sacrifice shall be in vain.

246028ce42b47b7b2dadce0886f12969.text: If another Mech dies but it doesn't have a pilot to die.

102b56ac4ecf5bfdd26dafa6994df013.text: Hate seeing good tech get destroyed...

8d9957188123389e5c2e6f2d21ad2f17.text: That Mech and its pilot are scrap metal - keep fighting!

b6f020c64fb03778d05e4750e4ee14aa.text: [ Att: Zenith. Transmitting #main_reverse designation no. and Timeline of Death to Pinnacle archives ]

0c2555a62b8cc01e56cbe9847e069a48.text: It's not a complete loss - Detritus can still salvage the wreckage.

f52d8ac6895299bfa66f1888e3819e8d.text: We needed that Mech, but at least it's not manned - keep fighting!

cd5afb849e880439e6d0077a9bf9de14.text: Do not let it distract you.

a07a6133417b13c6fc2163925c54745d.text: I shall ensure your shell and components are recycled into a new Mech.

f5368739cc1d14673fe5d2c2e8ca6f61.text: Your components shall gain life in a new Mech.

b6a768068a9cb4ba988681e2723430fa.text: We needed that Mech, unmanned or not.

292819a6dd04524283fd560dcc3e7522.text: Well, that's what happens when you let machines drive Mechs. No offense.

52370ee430f4f35d551888d9ce43e1ea.text: #main_mech is now ready for next shift pilot.

d799e8778a833dab8c40631fce9a0879.text: #main_mech designation number logged for next qualified pilot.

4dab578e7ad7adddd03e29621011871f.text: #main_mech is now acting as an obstruction to combat pathing.

52e401d230581b413d933e7aacc4e0c5.text: Request submitted to clear #main_mech obstruction from hazardous work zone.

b771ca32bb2ec38953c7e680620e806a.text: At l-l-least it didn't have a human pilot... s-sorry, that was rude of me.

af727f984a740a364e52b013d6f84d84.text: The next one that falls c-c-could be me.

5220e525578771e7ec6f74fa53182048.text: I... I think we can salvage that Mech, but the A.I. unit's beyond repair.

9ffaf9f73b9e3ce267e8a1896593c066.text: No matter how many machines the Vek destroy, we will find a way to make more. We must.

6b2f3965c7c2e1a8692daae9b08301cb.text: Even with its limited sentience, that A.I. unit would have been worth preserving

f6d8fd06ec06b349422f5db379bc7304.text: That limited A.I. was both an asset and a unique life. It will be missed.

4c2f0c229b70d9e25b5e5145415b47c3.text: We should be able to repair your Mech after the battle, commander. The A.I. unit, however, will need to be replaced.

8feb4cae9e0f397a85b29f3252744d30.text: Last thing pilot says before time traveling after a victory.

c98bca988fe3dbcced0af65f17285037.text: Update: Data drives ready for temporal breach

9d5ab9209ddfab7bfc419a83c1667670.text: Well #squad... see you all on the other side!

3873ab6160f3144beff5cc62578952c2.text: Time to redeploy to other timelines.

1ca866768b8cb8c2a60de9dcb0fa48aa.text: Old soldiers never die... they just jump to other timelines.

21a04cbf1812055dcf4064b12226b0c4.text: [ Initiating breach farewell protocol ]\n[ All Pinnacle thanks you, #squad ]

8dc5fb943867d4a5d5dba65c34f7cb8a.text: Now it's time to clean up a few more timelines...

63ee6b55072f46b0d3e2b4644cdcf98e.text: I... we... won. Maybe now we can turn the tide of the war everywhere.

c2e6efa13af1c6660a5258457e7fa7f1.text: Come on #squad... we've got other timelines to save.

92678a5bc0bf9ffcc7c5536c25b1a361.text: Our war is not yet won. Keep traveling. Keep fighting.

c9259b738beb42f71b7f0021f810710f.text: It looks like I'm off again... new timelines, new discoveries!

6514a9aee391e1720f0b3979bd758f20.text: The Vek have been uprooted from this timeline. Now the islands may thrive.

063a3d71c87244fd2e45bfc997cb8297.text: Vekticide complete. It is time for each of us to continue our cycle elsewhere.

3399deaaa63be5deb0f752ec637b90f6.text: Is this it? But... we'll see each other again? Maybe?

91893050d7cd964ef5f10f5baa4e9a40.text: Nothing to be sad about... snff... better to leave on a high note, right?

f115fadb3ecacc9f0de6dd45620c04c0.text: We beat the Vek! And that means we can do it again and save another timeline!

712c4c21502ea0345f13b47a6a5882aa.text: It's been an honor, #squad. In this timeline, and every timeline.

7931b5bd25560029693c7793f0d999d4.text: It's been a pleasure, team. If I see your counterparts, I'll give your regards.

848a1156cf6ad60ffda64bda1e165f52.text: Look, uh... I don't want to get misty-eyed or anything, but... well, I had a lot of fun.

f59c3c035300661c4b0cbd40390f3f7b.text: Until next time? Don't forget me. Or what we did today.

796913f27fbe8e61ac621d9868982460.text: It's... been an honor, commander, serving you and the #squad.

2fd6ab58815362904845d6662ba3e085.text: May we meet again when every timeline has been saved.

6a82f22b16c53e6b403f91d31c4896fe.text: Reconstruction of new temporal zone imminent. It has been efficient to have repaired this timeline with you, #squad.

2d99d045a22f9a2912e2430a44089bed.text: Our work continues. There are multiple timelines in need of repairs. The #squad had proven ourselves capable of the task.

63b208e4ecc0b9d9d993f5f1ed2504de.text: I... I wish you all luck, both you who remain in this timeline... and any who continue traveling.

903597ea9afbe7050f2e2010b13a4d5d.text: I... I suppose H.G. Wells is smiling at me now.

9ad8b00e1482f6aa7a9312795ce7e373.text: I... I will carry what I learned to the next timeline.

1c54f6ac6d9aecc7032cfe5a712e2330.text: Temporal excavation initiated. Re-engaging Vek in alternate timeline with new combat data.

2fb41a8abfc0fdc219336f2cfedfbbc4.text: My work here is at an end, yet the journey continues.

b0267b84e61ec17f99f3090a30b85eb7.text: Thank you, #squad... you saved us. You have our gratitude.

6c590c23833a1a7de013862f95cda932.text: My trust in you was not misplaced. You were tested, and you prevailed.

219082ed643d39b48cd8e2eb0bce7650.text: Farewell, #squad. You have saved us. Now see if you can save others.

434745c5cf068abc25b9af21b3b4eb6b.text: The Grid is collapsing! The island's lost!

eecd79d4c568b62e4fa93073ca528596.text: [ Att: Commander. Current timeline has suffered a catastrophic system failure ]

1471e5bde3dcf9b9d12a280d9c3782df.text: Grid engineers report a complete system failure.

8cca6f0b20aeb907bde7e41e472e42f9.text: I hoped we could do it this time.

eb66d445daa2f549ff45a53b5d4f33aa.text: Systems are losing power, Grid's going off-line!

b2c607a87943f694fa757e32057c17ce.text: The Grid is down. It's over.

34e3c2627d28c6a2919f0cdc3937c1ce.text: The... <warning> the... <emergency> the Grid that nourishes us is no more.

5e303293f554a50450a9cfa138905fe9.text: The Grid has perished. Shortly, the islands will be no more.

02800bbb4b5872bc9d74351523a1dff2.text: This island garden is lost. It belongs to the Vek parasites now.

9c72794fc1b91873950b94187a8eb436.text: Vekticide has failed. Humanity are the parasites now.

fb747b20ceb70230de629565744c325e.text: My controls are locked! What do we do?!

e86d6febdc6d6c996050daafe34c19e4.text: Grid's collapsing... the Vek have won. Again.

cb2d3dffe75b6bcb62f069a78fbb1197.text: This can't be happening! I did everything perfectly!

3a71df4e06d006bc03cc9652e1aa0361.text: What the hell? My technique was flawless!

0bc3b4e0226350b4cda84e8f6283c705.text: Power Grid's down. Reports of Vek swarming the islands... looks like we have no choice...

af9f77f986e409f6fada7089a0b554d3.text: Power Grid offline. Vek threat increasing. Advise immediate retreat.

11a0a08be1a1803af56f711a4ccf7e71.text: The Power Grid has surrendered, its circuits in full retreat. We must do the same.

368115f0313f7c2d4f559af772c4565e.text: I report the Power Grid has been lost in battle.

f3e0099780d07ad3798df5052c25a90e.text: Power Grid's d-d-down. We've f-failed... again...

f3479dc51d9767074721baa26cdf4fe2.text: Well, there goes the Grid. And the planet. No more sentients, no more humans.

f07b0394922eba581fcdea08065638f7.text: Power Grid shutting down! The Vek are overrunning the island!

f0a0adf565686489011585708cd62322.text: The Power Grid has collapsed! We've failed!

9602e6a59a93b99ab8a9704a05eea650.text: You've failed to protect the Grid! R.S.T.... all the islands... we're finished!

3953883964fbfbc833589d0fbb542b2b.text: The Grid is depleted. All sentient life will be extinguished from this timeline.

8a1cc4224d24f05c5d99a370a3fea5fe.text: Grid has failed! That... that's it for Detritus. For everyone.

2e445e1ea64972d8014235648606ddb9.text: Here goes... jumping to another timeline.

a57fa8d5a510a24503dd1ce0447c1693.text: This isn't the end. Initiating temporal breach protocols.

e5b5767a935703cc96352d1f8d70e801.text: [ Att: Commander: Initiating temporal breach protocols ]

ddea3744145545716d8452c2eba040f4.text: We need to follow failure protocols - initiate the breach.

a1ab847bd0e5fd885d6f56a60bf90a3e.text: We have to open a breach now!

4530db8b8985f3456c71a16559e7f466.text: We've lost - but only in this timeline. Opening a breach now!

9987d4ed8b82665aa8dfdf950e1c3515.text: We... we can try again. Next time - we'll succeed.

ec8c44768814ca8bb896b442c1bf862e.text: It is time for us to leave.

163e52762eabcca2980bb56ffa6d197a.text: This world is finished. Time to depart.

58e5ce3f9974c3298fd07038bd1d2bf9.text: Initiating a temporal breach. Let the cycle of life and death continue.

c9b130a48761d69c40d7377d0778e3aa.text: Breach initializing... farewell again, my Archive home.

d32ad330f0c18efb9e7d92e9aad0c168.text: Another timeline is in need of Vekticide protocols. Initiating breach.

6e1919f6b4461607e0c4a9c79fe10532.text: We'll just have to try again! Breach activating... now!

a02dd00c5006c6828c2f14948e4fb3a0.text: Initiating temporal breach. The next timeline awaits.

951ef817b8368f897c2ebb3fb02f8346.text: Nothing else to do but go back. No way I'll fail again!

38f452c01ab53d90d7040db1d22e61e6.text: Activate the breach! We'll have to try again!

65d0dfcf1f4ad0d7e2e4ffa956689a7a.text: We need to evac! Activating breach now!

a96ab277de03373c69093c042a102d44.text: Timeline is now a Vek hazard zone. New timeline work order being processed.

8c06bb41eb3fc39b548f7093445a5cc9.text: Construction efforts have failed. Activating temporal end-of-shift signal.

19f0003261acbeaecafead39d448339b.text: Temporal reconstruction halted. Authorizing new work order in new timeline.

990029412da1313ac7dd9f78cc7e77f2.text: We d-d-did all we could... prepare for t-t-temporal breach.

9fb615173a3ca9815a68f9e5e9660a04.text: I h-had thought this time... this timeline would be different. T-t-time to leave.

6584c0a6bee16a25ede03635e4f039a8.text: Temporal excavation initiated. Re-engaging Vek in alternate timeline.

9b4e5fc4a778798ccbe593c439e1b088.text: Shall we open a breach and try again?

fed339928674380d6c8797454ea87c77.text: If you truly can go back in time - do it now.

fec82712a58bf08532ffe87c4588a594.text: The Vek are erupting across the islands... if you can get to safety, do so.

7d0ef16e4f90ae7fbe6678872ede7761.text: If you are time travelers, then prove it. There is nothing more here.

645cb42fcaf3fea08083f057b7774cc3.text: Go now. If other timelines can be saved then you must do so.

4ebd1052c1fcdd10c05ebec3b854b689.text: Other timelines need you. Go while you can.

31b17684fc0cc7ef2fc9c9e3e34802ef.text: Lives can be saved in other timelines, go help them now.

8ef09ed38c95a9c7701721fe73f1eaee.text: When can I test it out?

555dab7a97e3ed335fe2e0bf0e4e6bb1.text: Checking the safety on the weapon now.

a0a9892d63942a4b36850d064d5b0010.text: Never saw something this advanced at Detritus.

4a58ea5262848970afcbaa9849bb2539.text: ...Have I used this in another timeline?

2532af2e32bde47c1a19a623a1fc3542.text: ...Hope they worked out the kinks with this in this timeline.

2e6c323a60b463f4e946270fda6e164c.text: Best use this now, I can't take it with me on the next jump.

eed28f444a3732e03be46f52d5926b50.text: ...Is it supposed to glow like that?

09e7e76f4e58788841ec56807787f879.text: Seems to have worked. Performing diagnostics now.

5d693d686dc8017a06fb68072ce4d5d8.text: Interesting. Its power capacitors can interface with nearly any hardware without any modifications...

e9486141724f3ebe35368c1f1e32afa5.text: Readouts are green. Could use some tweaking, of course, but I'll leave that for my lab.

abef91a3afcd711a25847132ab22b58a.text: Well, would you look at that. Clicks right into place!

9add9c78c5eb4cebdde5e61534fd0123.text: Is this a new gardening tool?

bcaae45e3a3d08164824f4ee0c081d42.text: This will enhance my Vekticide efforts.

075864c5f946630073fcc1e2094fbbbc.text: I am to balance the island ecology with this?

97e4b6a5a991984abf3f9cd3a7d4cdd4.text: Oooooh - I can't wait to try this out!

fdb2b17b952ba33fca507b392ea0d39d.text: The Vek won't know what hit them.

f1b08549fe2e5e2db85c8ad1572f0c4a.text: This should get the job done.

86f2ee11cdd9a7e6ab90f7031f814619.text: Perfect. I know just how to use this... but, uh, show me anyway.

3fba7726f2e7dee4598083974e73d857.text: Can't wait for the Vek to get a taste of this. It is a weapon, right?

6629f35413246046a084b4c0d4d12e98.text: Now we're playing with fire. I think. What is this again?

94b448fc38609a49f5e140f98ad977f6.text: Just give me my rifle and I'll be happy.

ffed12ab3519dded982734ace4acd237.text: ...If you think this is necessary, commander.

f53217dcad4c7e90434e9d9a89494e7d.text: This thing's bigger than I am.

2f67121221da75322b2ff7bd8c804348.text: Hardware install acknowledged. Accessing schematics and operation instructions.

4902558782299d2f3b123ce0dab9a9c0.text: Performing roll call of new systems. Systems, sound off.

b987053a4ec0030fdf1ca209a8189e27.text: Beginning rigorous component training. Components, at attention!

ac96476662ea4b795d525cefd0b283f0.text: To new device: Your training begins now.

9220b6b96389da1f9c2e468304a101b9.text: To new device: I expect nothing less than 100% performance.

5c24bfa1caec05187a404b58763ec031.text: W-wait... how do you work this thing again?

d91caec20b002df0e3114ff7bc270662.text: I'm n-not entirely c-comfortable with this.

91879b19f86d68cf4614ba0e768c01d3.text: My s-strengths lie in the lab, not live w-w-weapon tests.

25ab2f0382943b5f2101cd570763fc3f.text: Accessing the new device specifications now.

20f091adc495d27bd5cdf4b570a05116.text: I do hope we can disarm these as easily as upgrade them... for the human's sake.

33d8cc68db49ea8f2c3ad8bd7ffc3324.text: If you have no weapon powered. This plays every time you remove all weapons from the Pilot.

de7f3ba53c2924267ec2c5b3561c4308.text: Um, requesting ordnance, commander. Can't fight without it.

d746921fc9497f3d2f51297771151194.text: Um, I signed up partly to test weapons...

dfdadf659fd96465e9277451bc0b5766.text: I'm not combat-ready, commander. I need a weapon.

419cf12e21433e244480ce49d71d46c0.text: Will I be getting a replacement?

8deffc1d1939a3609ccdb9722a00d449.text: Are we expecting support in the field?

14a2baab65962154962ece30e9708cd1.text: If you're taking my weapon, please make sure it's stored safely.

4b59adeddcc20f36808f0725ccc5d65e.text: I can't go into battle unarmed. Commander.

1e339fec184aa93eebd8caa3fbde2716.text: Need a weapon before going into battle.

8d7676e81eddc04c1f2ecbc66c0bf034.text: I'm not going to fight the Vek empty-handed.

2888035cc1acfce8845d452c99e94583.text: Uh, Commander? I'm sorry, but I can't fight without a weapon...

d83dc68f96ade01413c36bde36deabcf.text: Happy to give visual support, but I'd feel better with a weapon.

b9b4325dffa5dba20d7cc6da7b14bbcb.text: Can you give me something from the science division to replace that?

912427d16949dad296221167c0f2de9c.text: If you're giving out new equipment, anything non-lethal is fine.

6107225d7bbdbd5471409f530d83e40a.text: This Mech is for battle. It must be armed.

d250ea7b7fa425952b7df46e0047febc.text: It would be... unproductive... to enter battle without any devices to test.

1510cc935724eeae671a038a47016ae4.text: I'd like to be more than just a decoy. Some armaments, perhaps?

b8987823279e01b22ffbae44413eef4c.text: Are you taking that away to upgrade it? Can I watch?

3e498888f26561a64a05b3066d69b3e3.text: Am I to return to my orchard on Archive?

694537800a2e5822139d7500f257a07b.text: I may be of more use with gardening weaponry.

42a04ee4b728d53c1833b8538a983f3d.text: I shall need a device for continuing Vekticide efforts.

0ff032b411b89c62a587426c2073658e.text: Wait, I can't take my #self_mech into battle without a weapon!

9ad86a9319c722260f52e3b5c44e1ff4.text: My little #self_mech doesn't have anything to kill the Vek with.

66c07b4638d6526312de16f22089e8a0.text: No! I promise I won't play around with it anymore!

3f38ade3023b72e0baeb6c721d05ab7b.text: I need a weapon before we engage the Vek.

556065d32de5906b9648107dd6af7877.text: Have something else I can use?

c091e068acd904cce4815f9ab68b7904.text: Either give me something new, or give that back.

8d1680566cda43fdf985e23f6f41397d.text: I'll need a weapon other than my winning smile.

752c3517c50784356ee6c5750cb02819.text: Unless you want me to just wave at the Vek, I need a gun.

e4495b045a739f732d2e0db27397b363.text: Do you expect me to use my fists? ...Commander.

8e44e13be85dbd513109885bb2378419.text: I hope you're planning to give that back.

99ffc77b86e3805d5db188613fc4000b.text: I'll need that back - or something stronger.

05abcac9d57fec97f93da6610a8ac2b0.text: Are you relieving me of duty?

bcffff8ba48c92438fb80b5f8188efa5.text: Critical warning. This unit is lacking weaponry.

d8e27b61dc4b72224beb450b606529ac.text: Is unit returning to construction duties?

8f02f7bffd2de451bfebbfb98de2bb6d.text: Was the device derelict in its duty?

b50e00ea3013e29dbd3b3a01687c965a.text: Am I... am I b-being removed from th-the fighting?

2747b81293cc9621f65015463329184c.text: If I h-have to go into battle, I'll need... well, s-s-something.

3a9a4c550598c25d542a9c81f4518e9f.text: Has m-my request for lab d-duty been approved?

1524fb64a0a78a3f4f6c8c269e9bc2a2.text: Has my t-t-transfer to the science division b-been approved, then?

ea4131d9a62c3f2c0a6162bb8eb3ce7a.text: Error in mining array. Excavation tool not found.

55444d132585d47ce7489f95b2817df0.text: Did the commander grant you permission you to touch my person?

e4b87b68857c1ee5894dc7d1a415b36c.text: I did not authorize my own disarmament.

ae613cc98c1254ef536c241efe88df6c.text: In my timeline, humans are not allowed to carry weapons, let alone disarm robots.

43526ff82accdf5f4ab5415a78e1ae8b.text: I am not accustomed to being disarmed by a human.

b4cb28952e574f2dca96de42a1a5f7f5.text: I shall require a device to counteract the Vek.

3b06bb9a74337d40b7659aa13c55bce3.text: Diverting reactor power to either Health or Move (basic Mech stats, not a weapon).

6de4348962f2e5cd496abb306349f34c.text: Power readouts are lighting up now.

01928bfa10b64257de3623a558f7c800.text: Reactor power has been diverted... running safety checks now.

daf3e0b2d861fd20be78f6608e4c74ea.text: Reactor safety is within acceptable limits.

f6d25ea2bd33c82612fbdf2c7680e39a.text: Internal diagnostics are in the green.

bb3a7370eddd8b1007bb761090eb1274.text: Sure glad it didn't decide to blow a gasket.

baa1372b78fd20c44e64adac61334654.text: Just the edge this Mech needs.

19c4431128b450b07251aee0b89010d9.text: ...Reactor makes my hair stand on end.

f773bfedb3b8dede32259eecd7b30fbe.text: I'll put this to good use!

7feeb3f412054132e2ddf4d33059a657.text: I wonder how much my Mech can be upgraded...

714f4a4aff54c2962ed0f26fa5057776.text: Can't wait to field test this!

4b3c3da1ec44acda0dc6ba0091262b15.text: ...What are you doing to my Mech?

113d02b13e64acd26607bdf704f94099.text: A blade must be sharpened, but not enough so it will break.

04e668581a48bd20c91e98b158b534a2.text: These Mechs' ability to upgrade power without overheating is remarkable...

71c5eb14001853494ef89c9d32c674a3.text: I wonder... what timeline did this reactor core technology come from?

9c59b888d398e000db798e13bfe928d8.text: The cores seem essential to our munitions.

daeebee4eaddbd4ab15be06f3a707fef.text: My Mech and I grow as one.

cc25e51a2394f5a446ee1d466cc58923.text: As it feeds, my Mech grows strong.

8b75a4b8ea3d399fd365f36c6afdd4bd.text: The reactor nourishes my Mech's systems.

e63ae4cebed66b2f8af7fe98296ace7a.text: This reactor shall ensure my Mech grows tall and strong.

d248d7296f0e4ca1c06c179646d67106.text: Aw, this is just what my little baby needed, didn't you? Didn't youuuu?

493584a3891d0b48129baa7378bd0eab.text: Aw, this is just what my little #self_mech needed, didn't you? Didn't youuuu?

5ed32198ec4d21a1049edba60221dd61.text: Reactor core installed - all systems green.

afacdb8c255af7efc2a41f91b35c751c.text: This Mech's primed and ready to go.

46330ebd8f18db05505c4de98617b335.text: Awww yeah... listen to that Mech purr.

5c10cb036a45921e843c596ea2ac6112.text: Listen to that reactor hum! But louder than before!

f843e16e2512066453283f2784ee87a9.text: Hey, are these things radioactive? Anyone?

dabd4197520a017951b9637843efb51b.text: Power output has increased. Well done, reactor, you are due for a promotion.

81808be1c73bf55cb9310563b08f2371.text: I w-wonder if this will even matter.

0febb4e36226b91662b5472340f45a36.text: So inspiring to see this Mech living up to its potential.

6a7453c97f3c03c2a822369ccd09f94e.text: A step in the right direction for such primitive systems.

f8edd00a615177e22444bcfac9b326b2.text: Up the ladder of scientific advances, one core at a time.

ff0b9597bafdcab98773c2f8ccc55ac5.text: It's a slow climb up the evolutionary ladder, but this Mech will get there!

818cd6bda7f08b5ea459c7b2baaaa65e.text: Let's turn the Vek into relics!

3c0c029c38fbf3325cf6e40f4d07b708.text: This Mech makes Archive's old-fashioned relics almost prehistoric.

285ad0d5e343e64210577400a4467d41.text: #main_second reporting in... safety checks complete, weapons online.

ed303a7f15c40242f6ce808da1463a10.text: Let's secure the region, clean and by the numbers.

67047e0ece463830b204ce05a03c18af.text: All right, #squad, let's make this a clean sweep.

a1da44f6d8302c4b8926226091f66460.text: Let's show these Vek how Detritus takes out the trash.

22c0ce425feb5b120e00ad6fb45cca11.text: It's garbage day... and here the Vek are, right on time.

45ee7cfd10c770be39ddc53bb582f941.text: Prioritize protecting the city. Mechs can be repaired... buildings can't.

0f5909bef614136c0117793234db1460.text: Time to make some Vek corpses.

b3f646d8e301eefe3d12afac9b0bbc20.text: Cut off the Vek escape routes. Then we'll wipe them out, one by one.

4d40c10759eaa25c78df7ca382b86125.text: We have to help these people!

4cd84f2721fbc2ed916f0a5e4018f1be.text: The rest of you, stay out of my way.

1c946eac7fd2acfbc8bbf54ddf40f374.text: Another chance to test this machine's capabilities!

f3fb109be7f7a46cfc00cbc54984fd94.text: Let's see how our Mechs perform in this field test!

408248a50fd343a51322cec9c86065ce.text: Vek parasites have infested the region. Activating Vekticide protocols.

fbff54cab35bc06756e5b46ca9441c91.text: Preparing recyclers to convert Vek into nutrients.

1a2d95fb84ead2987372fb5a757460de.text: Vek infestation detected in region. This garden must be sterilized.

134fe7e1368dcbf903e82525a41d49e5.text: Let's get this show on the road!

5891629eab0ef3c51e42e78fde895adf.text: Everyone, cover each other and protect the Grid.

b57b0f6cef6c12f65eacd635704e5edb.text: Remember - if the Grid falls, the battle is over.

57415decd69794806496079f19123c9e.text: You know the drill, #squad - clean and by the numbers.

03cc32109a71de2f02f8695a0e93c6f4.text: Everyone, you can relax, I'm here to save you!

099b99bf0adcc6a5d0b83e03c3a950bf.text: Let's paint the landscape with these Vek bastards.

9db1038e92369e12b2d7718949344000.text: Citizens of #corp, the ass-kicking machine you ordered has arrived.

7a70dcd2ee2ae8f5e5891e37a8065e9b.text: Enemies sighted. Ready on your mark, commander.

9cdafd1c3d100c9c5b496132ef60ed36.text: Deployment successful. Ready when you are, commander.

35e45007dbdbc5ec062facf8f20fb227.text: Assessing nearby threats to infrastructure. Deconstruction countermeasures initiated.
